verses.verse: The oracle<WH9294> concerning Moab.<WH4124> Surely<WH3588> in a night<WH3915> Ar<WH6144> of Moab<WH4124> is devastated<WH7703> [and] ruined;<WH1820> Surely<WH3588> in a night<WH3915> Kir<WH7024> of Moab<WH4124> is devastated<WH7703> [and] ruined.<WH1820>

They have gone<WH5927> up to the temple<WH1004> and [to] Dibon,<WH1769> [even] to the high<WH1116> places<WH1116> to weep.<WH1065> Moab<WH4124> wails<WH3213> over<WH5921> Nebo<WH5015> and Medeba;<WH4311> Everyone's head<WH7218> is bald<WH7144> [and] every<WH3605> beard<WH2206> is cut<WH1639> off.<WH1639>

In their streets<WH2351> they have girded<WH2296> themselves with sackcloth;<WH8242> On their housetops<WH1406> and in their squares<WH7339> Everyone<WH3605> is wailing,<WH3213> dissolved<WH3381> in tears.<WH1065>

Heshbon<WH2809> and Elealeh<WH500> also cry<WH2199> out, Their voice<WH6963> is heard<WH8085> all<WH5704> the way<WH5704> to Jahaz;<WH3096> Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the armed<WH9139> men of Moab<WH4124> cry<WH7321> aloud;<WH7321> His soul<WH5315> trembles<WH3415> within him.

My heart<WH3820> cries<WH2199> out for Moab;<WH4124> His fugitives<WH1281> are as far<WH5704> as Zoar<WH6820> [and] Eglath-shelishiyah, For they go<WH5927> up the ascent<WH4608> of Luhith<WH3872> weeping;<WH1065> Surely<WH3588> on the road<WH1870> to Horonaim<WH2773> they raise<WH5782> a cry<WH2201> of distress<WH2201> over [their] ruin.<WH7667>

For the waters<WH4325> of Nimrim<WH5249> are desolate.<WH4923> Surely<WH3588> the grass<WH2682> is withered,<WH3001> the tender<WH1877> grass<WH1877> died<WH3615> out, There is no<WH3808> green<WH3418> thing.<WH3418>
Therefore<WH5921> <WH3651> the abundance<WH3502> [which] they have acquired<WH6213> and stored<WH6486> up They carry<WH5375> off over<WH5921> the brook<WH5158> of Arabim.<WH6155>

For the cry<WH2201> of distress<WH2201> has gone<WH5362> around<WH5362> the territory<WH1366> of Moab,<WH4124> Its wail<WH3215> [goes] as far<WH5704> as Eglaim<WH97> and its wailing<WH3213> even to Beer-elim.

For the waters<WH4325> of Dimon<WH1775> are full<WH4390> of blood;<WH1818> Surely<WH3588> I will bring<WH7896> added<WH3254> [woes] upon Dimon,<WH1775> A lion<WH9030> upon the fugitives<WH6413> of Moab<WH4124> and upon the remnant<WH7611> of the land.<WH127>
